storyInfo: After losing her position as a Mounted Police officer, Grani’s investigation comes to an impasse. However, the obstacles she will face are still much, much greater.

attributes.content: Deedee, where are you?
attributes.name: Anxious Child

attributes.content: Look, I've brought your favorite jerky!
attributes.name: Anxious Child

attributes.content: Eric! I found him!
Where at, Miss Grani?
attributes.name: Eric

attributes.content: Whooooa! I can't get a hold of him, and he's gonna get away! Hurry!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: C'mon now, this way. I have your jerky right over here, so stop running around.
attributes.name: Eric

attributes.content: Where'd you find him, Miss Grani?
attributes.name: Eric

attributes.content: Phew, he was trying to make his way down into the sewers. But thanks to that shiny little rump, I was able to catch him before he could squirm down there.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: But you've got to keep an eye on him, Eric. I'm not with the Mounted Police anymore, so I'm not gonna be able to help you find him on patrol anymore.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Thanks, Miss Grani. And, I know... But it sure is weird. Deedee's usually so well-behaved, and never goes running around like this. Why'd he be trying to hide in the sewers?
attributes.name: Eric

attributes.content: Good question. You hear that, Deedee? Care to explain?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Huh? Did you get something dirty on you? It's all dark and... Hey! Don't climb on me!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Shoot, almost forgot! I need to head over to the hospital!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Sorry I'm late. Ran into a little incident while passing through the Infected district.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: More of your good deeds, Grani?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Heheh... So where's Kurt Jr.? He still with you guys?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Second bed on the right. Oh, but...
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Thanks a bunch! I'll go pay him a visit!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Uhh...
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: He's not going to be able to answer any questions. The doctor has already administered his injection, and he just fell asleep.
Sir... How's your son doing right now?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: The doctor said his condition was stable, but he keeps waking up in the middle of the night.
attributes.name: Kurt Sr.

attributes.content: Sometimes he starts screaming the moment he does. He'll grip my hands hard and cry, 'it hurts, dad!' But there's nothing I can do except wait for the doctor to rush over with the shot.
attributes.name: Kurt Sr.

attributes.content: More often than not, though, he just sits in bed staring at me without saying anything. As if those two wide eyes are looking right through me.
attributes.name: Kurt Sr.

attributes.content: The doctors at Rhodes Island are very experienced in dealing with Oripathy. He WILL get better, it's just a matter of time.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Mm...
attributes.name: Kurt Sr.

attributes.content: Don't you worry. Even if the Mounted Police are no more, I'll get to the bottom of this case. Justice will be done!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: You're a good officer, Grani. Always have been.
attributes.name: Kurt Sr.

attributes.content: Grani, here's that Originium detector you wanted to borrow. It's a bit heavy though. You sure you can carry it back by yourself?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: No problem! Thanks, and sorry for imposing on you again.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Don't mention it. We've known each other long enough.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: By the way, is Kurt Jr.'s case not settled yet? Did the factory not provide any compensation?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Yeah. Before the Mounted Police were disbanded, we searched that factory from top to bottom for anything suspicious.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: The eyewitness says he got caught up in the explosion in the distillation tower, which gave him Oripathy.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: But there were no traces of an explosion or any contaminants in Work Area #3, where it allegedly happened. No sign of a cleanup either.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: That makes no sense.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Originally, the factory supervisor denied any sort of incident happened at all. Then later, they claimed that the Mounted Police failed to produce any evidence, and put pressure on the department to get our investigation shut down.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: And now that the Mounted Police are gone, the case has been transferred to the guards, and no way are they gonna do anything about it.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: 'That's an internal matter for Bolton Chemicals–' That's all the captain will say, in that pinched voice of his.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Kurt Jr. has been in that hospital bed for how long now? And they're still hanging up the investigation? Unbelievable.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Which is why it's up to me to keep things going.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: But you're a guard in name only now, while they figure out where to reassign you. And even if you have the equipment to investigate, how are you going to get access to the factory?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: No one said it would be easy.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: I can't even begin to imagine how hard it'll be.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Eh, don't worry about me. Heck, I've been a mountie long enough to make connections. I'll make sure things work out.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Oh, right. About Kurt Jr.... How's his condition, for real? I don't think you're giving his dad the whole truth.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: *sigh*... Nothing gets past you, does it? I didn't lie to him. I just... omitted the most harrowing detail.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: His condition has indeed stabilized, but his Cell-Originium Assimilation rate is very high. Coupled with the damage to his body caused by long-term physical labor, it's... hard to give a prognosis.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Even in the best case scenario, he may end up spending the rest of his life bedridden.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: He's only twenty-six years old, isn't he? No wonder you didn't want to break the news to his dad...
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: I promise you, Grani, we'll do everything we can.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: I know, I trust you guys. Thanks, though.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Alright then, I'm gonna head back first. After I get this whole thing under wraps, let's hang out again!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: One sec.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: In addition to treating Oripathy, we're also very experienced at handling Originium contamination. If you ever need help with that, give us a call.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Got it. As a member of the Mounted– I mean, who do you think I am? Grani, that's who.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Two glasses of Big Johann's Special... Err, make that one special and one dry martini please. Appreciate it.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Phew–– Now then...
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Here, over here!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Didn't expect us to be meeting up in a conspicuous place like this, Officer... I mean, Grani.
It's the same place as always. Nothing wrong with that, is there?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Do you know how dangerous it is for me to meet with you privately these day?
attributes.name: Mysterious Informant

attributes.content: Yeah, yeah. I'll make it up to you with this. Here, your favorite dry martini.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: So did you bring what I asked for?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Here you go. A list of all the orders Bolton Chemicals has made this past year.
attributes.name: Mysterious Informant

attributes.content: Want me to start with the conclusion?
attributes.name: Mysterious Informant

attributes.content: Go for it.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: You were right on the money. This last year, they've been ramping up their purchases of refined Originium, processing equipment, and raw materials. It's clear that they're upping production capacity.
attributes.name: Mysterious Informant

attributes.content: When it was already close to saturation? But why?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Londinium hasn't known peace for quite some time. Anyone with a keen eye can tell that our precious dukes have been getting jittery.
attributes.name: Mysterious Informant

attributes.content: High-speed battleships need maintenance, and armies need supplies. What better time to ramp up production for the days ahead?
attributes.name: Mysterious Informant

attributes.content: Bolton Chemicals is the pillar of Rydell City’s industries. If they wanted to ramp up production, they could just go through the city...
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: But that takes money, which cuts into their bottom line. The most cost-effective way of increasing production capacity is... simply to have more in the first place.
attributes.name: Mysterious Informant

attributes.content: Seeing how new contamination treatment equipment isn't anywhere on this list, they must still be using the same old equipment and pipelines that were already getting overwhelmed before.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: And the end result is... kaboom.
attributes.name: Mysterious Informant

attributes.content: Thanks, I seriously owe you one. I can guarantee you this document's gonna come in handy. As for what comes next, I might need your help again.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Grani.
attributes.name: Mysterious Informant

attributes.content: Huh? Yeah?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: I can't help you anymore.
attributes.name: Mysterious Informant

attributes.content: Huh? Don't joke around like that. We've been working together for so long, and you know how much I rely on you.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: How about this? When we wrap up this Kurt Jr. case, I'll treat you to a nice meal at Rollin' Rotunda to show my appreciation. How does that sound?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: I'm serious, Grani. You're no longer Mounted Police, which means our cooperation has come to an end.
attributes.name: Mysterious Informant

attributes.content: Moreover, as you've seen, this incident can't be boiled down to something as simple as 'a little accident happened and the factory refused to pay compensation.' It involves the future of a large enterprise. There's no need for you to wade into these murky waters.
attributes.name: Mysterious Informant

attributes.content: Danny, don't try to talk me out of it.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: I'm not. It's just a warning. I'm saying this as your friend– don't pursue this case. It'll all resolve itself, which is in everyone's best interest anyway.
attributes.name: Mysterious Informant

attributes.content: ...Alright, if you want out, I'm not gonna stop you. I know you have your reasons, but I have mine too.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: This was the last case before the Mounted Police were disbanded. But we've seen our fair share, and it's not like we've never butted heads with Bolton Chemicals before either.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Plus, I can't just watch Kurt Jr. lie in bed for the rest of his life. It's my responsibility to keep investigating.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: There's that sense of justice again. This isn't some exam at the police academy. After all these years, do you still not understand the kind of land you live in?
attributes.name: Mysterious Informant

attributes.content: Do you expect Bolton to just defer to you officers like before, bowing their heads and offering up a settlement to apologize? You've never seen them bare their fangs, have you?
attributes.name: Mysterious Informant

attributes.content: I don't care; I'm not afraid of them. Do they have what it takes to stop the business end of my spear?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: You think they'd only go after you? Hah. They've already made their move.
attributes.name: Mysterious Informant

attributes.content: Notice how many people's eyes have been on you, ever since I stepped into this bar?
attributes.name: Mysterious Informant

attributes.content: The folks who come to Big Johann's are all neighbors and fellow workers. I used to come here all the time after patrol, so I know them well.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Take a look at this then, Grani.
attributes.name: Mysterious Informant

attributes.content: What's this form?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: 'Notice: Due to ongoing investigations by the Mounted Police, the Rydell City factory has sustained significant economic losses. As such, management has unanimously decided that...'
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: 'Employee salaries and labor pensions will be reduced by percentage, according to the employee's rank. See the following table for details...'
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: What?! How dare they?!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: So, did you not notice... how quiet it's been in here?
attributes.name: Mysterious Informant

attributes.content: Grani suddenly lifts her head. When she senses the gazes fixed on her from all directions, she feels like a fowlbeast perched alone on an empty branch.
Her surroundings are deathly quiet. Even their eyes are full of empty silence, like the wilderness itself.
Her throat starts to feel tight.
Hey there, guys...
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: A rock lands on the table with a heavy thud, knocking over the full glass of Big Johann's Special.
It's clear that it came from the street outside, shattering the glass and sailing over her head in a dangerous arc before landing front of her.
Grani sprints out of the bar.
Who's there?!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Who did that?! Show yourself!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Her voice echoes through the night streets.
Not a soul is there to answer her.
Sorry for calling everyone here even though the Mounted Police have already been disbanded.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: You all remember the case with Kurt Jr., right? Well... I got my hands on new evidence confirming that Bolton Chemicals increased production capacity and created new work hazards in violation of safety regulations.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: But I still don't have conclusive evidence proving that the explosion did in fact take place, meaning I don't have anything to submit to the relevant departments to force Bolton to admit fault for his injuries.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: A number of you... should be with the guards by now, so I'd like to ask for your help.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: I borrowed a high-precision Originium detector in case I could find a way of getting back into the factory to do some investigating.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: ...So is anyone on board?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Chief...
attributes.name: Guards Member A

attributes.content: I'm not your chief anymore. Just call me Grani.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Grani... It's way too dangerous to be investigating Bolton right now.
attributes.name: Guards Member B

attributes.content: I know, I know. You've just taken your new posts, and you'd have to get your hands dirty for this. You might even take some heat for it.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: But... Kurt Jr.'s situation isn't looking very good, and they're still putting more pressure on their other workers. This is urgent.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Do you still remember? The day we left the Mounted Police, we were all so upset that we couldn't scrounge up any evidence to keep this case alive. But now we have!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Maybe I don't even have to go in myself. If any of you can come up with a reason to take a look around and find some evidence, that's more than enough.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Grani, we...
attributes.name: Guards Member A

attributes.content: And after Kurt Jr. recovers, we can all go for some apple pie together. How nice would that be?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Chief, I'll give it to you straight. The captain warned all of us former mounties that we are strictly prohibited from pursuing any further investigations relating to Bolton.
attributes.name: Guards Member B

attributes.content: In particular... we were forbidden from having any contact with you.
attributes.name: Guards Member B

attributes.content: What the...?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: We're all taking a big risk just to meet like this, because we know the captain's a huge douche, and you're... always gonna be our chief.
attributes.name: Guards Member B

attributes.content: Always have been, always will.
attributes.name: Guards Member B

attributes.content: Lily... You guys...
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Chief, I miss fighting alongside you, really. All we had to do was follow the shorty and charge forward without thinking. And somehow, everything would work itself out.
attributes.name: Guards Member B

attributes.content: But since I left the Mounted Police, I came to a realization– outside of endlessly fighting and solving other people's problems, I also have a life of my own.
attributes.name: Guards Member B

attributes.content: ...So I'm sorry, Chief.
attributes.name: Guards Member B

attributes.content: C'mon, don't give up. There has to be a way... We can talk it through, just like how we used to. Am I wrong?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Chief, Bolton controls the fate of so many people, including our neighbors, relatives, and loved ones.
attributes.name: Guards Member A

attributes.content: They're serious this time. Even if we still wore our old uniforms, there'd be nothing we could do in the face of such a behemoth, let alone...
attributes.name: Guards Member A

attributes.content: Just forget about the case already, Chief!
attributes.name: Guards Member A

attributes.content: All the more reason we can't stop now! If we don't make a stand, who will? Who's going to protect the next person to get hurt?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Listen up, you guys–
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Grani! Have you never wondered why our city's Mounted Police was first to get disbanded?
attributes.name: Guards Member B

attributes.content: Wasn't it just a reassignment–– Oh...
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: There was nothing we could do back then, and there's nothing we can do now. Protecting others and stuff? Leave it to the powerful. It's not our job.
attributes.name: Guards Member B

attributes.content: ...I see, I get it now. Sorry, guys. I'm the one who should be apologizing. Don't let me keep you, then. I'll figure something out myself.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Chief, there's still room in the Toron Guards. I'll put in a good word for you.
attributes.name: Guards Member A

attributes.content: Thanks. But... you know how I am.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Can there really be no clues in all these investigation files?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Think Grani, think.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: No evidence of contaminant leakage was found in the factory, which means they must've had some way of moving it out.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Of course! They moved it out!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: If I can find evidence that they left traces of contaminants in the nearby environment, we can submit that to the Department of Oripathy Prevention and Control and request that they shut down the factory! And they absolutely can't afford to lose the factory!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Which means they'll have no choice but to admit fault while downplaying the issue and promising to improve their contamination treatment system.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: But the question is, HOW did they manage to transport the contaminants?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: I can't contact my informant anymore, can't get inside the factory, and can't go walking around the city waving an Originium detector around, so... what other options do I have...?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: *sigh* Guess I'll start at the outskirts of town and get familiar with the equipment first... Rhodes Island's stuff sure is high-tech, though. I think this is how you turn it on?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Beep. Active Originium particles detected. Risk: Low...
attributes.name: System Voice

attributes.content: Huh? In my room?!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: (Picks up the detection probe)
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Beep– Originium particle concentration increasing.
attributes.name: System Voice

attributes.content: Is this... the mud I got on my clothes when I was searching for Deedee?!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: No way, don't tell me...
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: The domestic drainage pipes...
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: We've been going at it all wrong from the start. We assumed they secretly treated the contaminants before transporting them away, but if they never bothered to treat them in the first place...
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: They discharged contaminants directly into the pipelines of the Infected communities! Even if an outbreak took place, it'd just be blamed on the Infected!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Those bastards! How dare they stoop this low!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: The black mud from before is gone, and the readings are back to normal... I guess they went and cleaned it up.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: But... when we inspected the discharge facilities in Work Area #3, we found no signs of pipes being replaced.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Well, I'll worry about that later! Now that I know what they were doing, I'll find the evidence as long as I keep digging. This'll prevent it from spreading to the Infected communities, too!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Or... maybe I could ask Rhodes Island for help.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Huh? Lily? At this hour...?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Hello? Is something wrong?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: The case is about to be closed? Kurt Sr. agreed to sign a Letter of Understanding?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: At the factory? I'll be there right away!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Hey, you! Hold up, you're not allowed inside!
attributes.name: Factory Security

attributes.content: Out of the way!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Is that the former Mounted Police officer from before? Let her in.
attributes.name: Retained Lawyer

attributes.content: Good day, Miss Grani... Former Mounted Police.
attributes.name: Retained Lawyer

attributes.content: The agreement was signed by both parties, and handled without issue by the guards. Of course, we do appreciate the Mounted Police's previous cooperation on this matter.
attributes.name: Retained Lawyer

attributes.content: ...Don't care to shake hands? So be it.
attributes.name: Retained Lawyer

attributes.content: You... Do you have any idea what you've done?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Calm down, ma'am. I'm just doing what I'm paid for, so don't take it out on me.
attributes.name: Retained Lawyer

attributes.content: Go back and tell your boss this: I've found evidence that the factory has been leaking contaminants and dumping them into domestic pipelines! And they're not gonna get away with it!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: I'll pass it on verbatim. However... as it stands, the case is legally closed.
attributes.name: Retained Lawyer

attributes.content: Out of respect for you, I must remind you that you are no longer a Mounted Police officer. With no one to back you up, waving a weapon around like that is most disgraceful.
attributes.name: Retained Lawyer

attributes.content: Whatever you think you're about to do, you may find it difficult to retain legal assistance in the matter.
attributes.name: Retained Lawyer

attributes.content: ...They should just surrender themselves! They'll be brought to justice for their arrogance!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Thank you for your contribution to Rydell City. I sincerely hope that you have a long and successful career ahead of you.
attributes.name: Retained Lawyer

attributes.content: Also, in your future endeavors, please double check that the work area number wasn't changed.
attributes.name: Retained Lawyer

attributes.content: What?!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: I'll be taking my leave. Oh right, Kurt Sr., the compensation funds will be transferred to your account shortly. Please take a look.
attributes.name: Retained Lawyer

attributes.content: Mm...
attributes.name: Kurt Sr.

attributes.content: Why, sir?! We were so close to getting justice for your son! You didn't have to sign off on this!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: ...Grani, you're a good kid, and you've always been a good officer.
attributes.name: Kurt Sr.

attributes.content: But... you're not one of Rydell City's laborers. I've worked here my entire life, and the same goes for my son.
attributes.name: Kurt Sr.

attributes.content: And I can help you both! Please believe me! I'm not gonna give up on this!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: My son, he... he's already gone.
attributes.name: Kurt Sr.

attributes.content: Grani can only stand there blankly.
She walks down the street, alone.
She takes one deep breath after another, letting the murky, industrial air fill her lungs.
She unclenches her fist, her knuckles now white, and gently pats her spear case slung over her shoulder.
...It's just you and me now.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Let's go grab a bite first. If we keep at it, there might just be a way.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: This is nothing I can't handle myself...
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: A gust of wind blows past, lifting a stack of waste paper beside a trash can.
She grabs hold of a page from a fluttering newspaper and sees something printed inconspicuously at the bottom.
She holds her breath.
'A car accident... on Third Avenue...'
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: 'Bolton Chemicals manager Danny Coleman was critically injured and sent to the hospital for treatment, where he remains unconscious...'
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: She crumples the piece of paper into a tiny wad, her thin body trembling slightly.
She stops walking and turns her eyes upward, only to see dark clouds gathering in the sky.
Oh...
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: *sobbing*––
Someone's crying? Where's it coming from...?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Eric?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: *sniffle*... *sob*...
attributes.name: Eric

attributes.content: What's wrong, Eric? What happened?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Miss Grani... It's Deedee... He...
attributes.name: Eric

attributes.content: After we found him that day, he stopped moving and refused to eat...
attributes.name: Eric

attributes.content: She sees the beastling curled up in the boy's arms like a newborn.
Its paw trembles, and after a violent spasm, it collapses like a deflated balloon.
Its breathing stops.
Deedee? Deedee? What's the matter with you? Deedee?
attributes.name: Eric

attributes.content: Grani squeezes the beastling's still-warm paw.
Just as she had expected, she notices a hard, grainy feeling against her fingertips.
The crystal particles that broke through its skin have claimed yet another life.
No, this can't be happening! Why Deedee? He was always so nice and well-behaved, never bit anyone, was never bad...
attributes.name: Eric

attributes.content: Right? He was always good, right Miss Grani?
attributes.name: Eric

attributes.content: Eric...
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Deedee has gone somewhere far away. A kinder, more beautiful place.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: No... Why did it have to be Deedee...?
attributes.name: Eric

attributes.content: The child lets out a sob and tightly clings to the beastling's body.
She hugs the child close.
That's right... It never should've happened to Kurt Jr., or to Deedee. It shouldn't have been them.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: ...Hello? This is Grani.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Five days later.
My son...
attributes.name: Kurt Sr.

attributes.content: Sir...
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Grani... Didn't you already leave?
attributes.name: Kurt Sr.

attributes.content: I brought flowers for Kurt Jr.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Thank you.
attributes.name: Kurt Sr.

attributes.content: Do you miss him?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: ...When he was still around, we used to fight all the time. I cussed him out in the most vicious ways, and kicked him out of the house.
attributes.name: Kurt Sr.

attributes.content: But recently, I've been seeing him in my dreams. He'd follow me calling 'daddy, daddy,' just like when he was little.
attributes.name: Kurt Sr.

attributes.content: Did you dream about him on the day you signed that Letter of Understanding?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: I did.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: In my dream, I saw him, all the other Mounted Police, and all of Rydell City's neighbors and workers holding hands and going round-and-round in a big circle for his twenty-seventh birthday.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: The candlelight shone on his face. He was singing and dancing with such a joyous expression.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Sir, I left five days ago to reach out to a certain company.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: And now I'm back to keep my promise.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Only then does the old man realize that the youth beside him is clutching a cold, glimmering spear in her other hand.
She grips its shaft resolutely.
I hate those who misbehave, those who bully the weak, and those who would manipulate our lives as they please.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: I promise you– as long as I can hold this spear, I will do everything in my power to see those people pay.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: And I never go back on my word.
attributes.name: Grani
